docs.summary:
The wix-crm module contains functionality for working with your
 site's contacts from client-side code.
description: To use the CRM API, import `wixCRM` from the `wix-crm` module:
``` javascript
import wixCRM from 'wix-crm';

srcDocs.summary:

 site's contacts from client-side code.
description: To use the CRM API, import `wixCRM` from the `wix-crm` module:

import wixCRM from 'wix-crm';

params.name: handler
params.doc: The name of the function or the function expression to run when a user has logged in.
params.srcDoc: The name of the function or the function expression to run when a user has logged in.

docs.summary: Creates new contact in Wix CRM
description: Use the `onLogin()` function for code you want to run after a user successfully
logs into your site.
Usually, you want to call the `onLogin()` function in the **Site** tab of the
code panel so that the `onLogin()` event handler will be run no matter which
page on your site a user uses to log in.

examples.title: Run code when a user logs in

srcDocs.summary: Creates new contact in Wix CRM
description: Use the `onLogin()` function for code you want to run after a user successfully

examples.title: Run code when a user logs in

params.name: emailId
params.doc: The Email ID of the Triggered Email to send.
params.srcDoc: The Email ID of the Triggered Email to send.

params.name: options
params.doc: Variable values to insert into the email.
params.srcDoc: Variable values to insert into the email.

ret.doc: on fulfilled - When the email is sent.. on rejected - Error message.
ret.srcDoc: on fulfilled - When the email is sent.. on rejected - Error message.

docs.summary: Sends a Triggered Email to the contact.
description: To learn more about Triggered Emails, see:
+ [About Triggered Emails](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-triggered-emails)
+ [Creating a Triggered Email](https://support.wix.com/en/article/creating-a-triggered-email)
+ [How to Send a Triggered Email with Code](https://support.wix.com/en/article/how-to-send-a-triggered-email-with-code)
Before using the `emailContact()` function, you will need to set up at least one
Triggered Email.
Specify which email to send by passing the email's ID in the `emailId` parameter.
Specify which contacts the email is sent to by passing the contact's ID in the `toContact`
parameter.
If the specified Triggered Email contains [variables](https://support.wix.com/en/article/using-variables-to-add-personalized-text),
you can pass values for those variables using the optional `options` parameter.
You pass a [`TriggeredEmailOptions`](#TriggeredEmailOptions) object
which contains the values to be inserted into your email in place of the variables
defined in that email. The values passed must be strings. If the object you
pass to the `options` parameter does not contain a `key:value` pair for a
variable in your Triggered Email, the fallback value defined when creating
your Triggered Email will be inserted in place of the variable.
Note that Triggered Emails generates a code snippet for each of your email
templates. The generated code includes the email's ID and keys for all the
email's variable names. You can copy and paste the snippet into your code.
Then you will need to define values for the `toContact` property and for each
variable key. To learn how to use the generated snippet in your code, see
[How to Send a Triggered Email with Code](https://support.wix.com/en/article/how-to-send-a-triggered-email-with-code).

srcDocs.summary: Sends a Triggered Email to the contact.
description: To learn more about Triggered Emails, see:
+ [About Triggered Emails](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-triggered-emails)
+ [Creating a Triggered Email](https://support.wix.com/en/article/creating-a-triggered-email)
+ [How to Send a Triggered Email with Code](https://support.wix.com/en/article/how-to-send-a-triggered-email-with-code)
Before using the `emailContact()` function, you will need to set up at least one
Triggered Email.
Specify which email to send by passing the email's ID in the `emailId` parameter.
Specify which contacts the email is sent to by passing the contact's ID in the `toContact`
parameter.
If the specified Triggered Email contains [variables](https://support.wix.com/en/article/using-variables-to-add-personalized-text),
you can pass values for those variables using the optional `options` parameter.
You pass a [`TriggeredEmailOptions`](#TriggeredEmailOptions) object
which contains the values to be inserted into your email in place of the variables
defined in that email. The values passed must be strings. If the object you
pass to the `options` parameter does not contain a `key:value` pair for a
variable in your Triggered Email, the fallback value defined when creating
your Triggered Email will be inserted in place of the variable.
Note that Triggered Emails generates a code snippet for each of your email
templates. The generated code includes the email's ID and keys for all the
email's variable names. You can copy and paste the snippet into your code.
Then you will need to define values for the `toContact` property and for each
variable key. To learn how to use the generated snippet in your code, see
[How to Send a Triggered Email with Code](https://support.wix.com/en/article/how-to-send-a-triggered-email-with-code).

docs.summary: An object that contains information about a site contact.

members.name: loginEmail
members.docs:
Email address the contact uses to log
 into the system.

members.name: customFields
members.docs:
Any
 number of custom fields. Use keys that match the names you've defined using
 your site's dashboard.
